column1: #Text=Ollier ' s Disease Larry Chen Mary Wyers , M . D .

#Text=Children ' s Memorial Hospital Abstract 4 yo male with hand deformity Keywords Ollier ' s Disease , enchondroma Publication Date : 2004 - 06 - 16 History 4 yo male with hand deformity Findings PA view of the hand : Lytic partially calcified lesions of the proximal phalanges of the thumb and first finger with associated deformity .
#Text=There is also a lesion in the proximal radial metaphysis .
#Text=Diagnosis Ollier ' s Disease Discussion The syndrome of multiple enchondromas or enchondromatosis is known as Ollier disease .
#Text=If the enchondromatosis is associated with soft tissue hemangiomas , the disorder is called Maffucci syndrome .
#Text=Enchondromas are usually solitary , located in the metaphyseal region of tubular bones , and the favored sites are the short tubular bones of the hands and feet .
#Text=Chondromas are thought to develop from rests of growth plate cartilage that subsequently proliferate and slowly enlarge .
#Text=Based on this theory , it is not surprising that these tumors arise mainly in bones that develop from enchondral ossification .
#Text=PRACTICAL PEDIATRIC RADIOLOGY , 3rd Ed , Lipincott : New York , 1998 , 358 - 9 .
